title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.9 | 12-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Shri Shukadev Goswami was already on the path of self-realization and thus he was pleased with his own self. Why did he take the trouble to undergo the self-realization, the study of such a vast literature?
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Shounaka's question about why Shukadeva Goswami, already self-realized, undertook the study of the vast Shreemad Bhagavatam, and begins to explain the concept of sense gratification.
segments.transcript: In this session, we will be discussing from the 9th verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Shreemad Bhagavatam: शाउनकव वाच. Now, after सूतकव स्वामी said that व्यास देवा taught the Shreemad Bhagavatam to his own son, immediately शाउनकव interrupts सूतकव स्वामी and asks a very, very important question. Kindly hear this question very attentively: शाउनकव वाच सवै निवृत्ति निरतहा सर्वत्रो पेक्षको मुनिही कस्यवा ब्रहतीम एताम आत्मा रामस समभ्यसत. The meaning is Shri Shounaka asked सूतकव स्वामी, "Shri Shukadev Goswami was already on the path of self-realization, and thus he was pleased with his own self, आत्मा रामा. Why did he take the trouble to undergo the self-realization, the study of such a vast literature? भागवत्म is no small literature, 18,000 verses. Why did he undergo the trouble when he was already on the path of self-realization?" So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada explains, "For the people in general, the highest perfection of life is to cease from material activities and be fixed on the path of self-realization." फहा कि first काथवित है कि Cease for material activity means that these material activities are activities which are aimed at sense gratification. Sense gratification means the senses are always demanding some pleasure, some pleasing object of the senses. For the eyes, it is a beautiful form; for the ears, it is some melodious music or some praise. For the tongue, it is some palliative beauty. For the tongue, it is some palliative beauty. For the tongue, it is some palliative beauty.

segments.key_quote: Srimad Bhagavatam is a post-graduate study even for the atmarama's who have to surpass all the studies of vedic knowledge.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Srimad Bhagavatam is beyond material enjoyment and even liberation, making it a postgraduate study for Atma-ramas, those who are self-satisfied.
segments.transcript: Soul pleasure of the self. Atma means self, and arama means to take pleasure. Of course, everybody wants pleasure, but the standard may not be the same. Therefore, the standard of pleasure enjoyed by the karmis, the materialistic persons, is different from that of the atma rama's, the transcendentalists. The atma rama's are completely indifferent to material enjoyment in every respect. Why is Srila Prabhupada mentioning this? Because he is trying to explain what is the need for Shukadeva Goswami to undertake study of this vast literature when he was already self-satisfied. What is the impetus? So, Srila Prabhupada says atma rama's are indifferent to material enjoyment. They are not interested in material enjoyment. Srila Shukadeva Goswami had already attained that stage. What stage? The stage of atma rama, taking pleasure in the self or the soul, and still he was attracted to undergo the trouble of studying the great Bhagavatam literature. segments.key_quote: If you were to be able to get an ocean of spiritual happiness then that ocean of spiritual happiness cannot equal even one drop of devotional happiness.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts spiritual happiness with devotional happiness, emphasizing the latter's superiority and its presence in Srimad Bhagavatam, and describes the characteristics of a pure devotee who is uninterested in liberation, seeking only to serve Krishna.
